humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the report, there are positive lymph nodes in the right axilla. Specifically, sentinel node #1 has 1/6 positive lymph nodes and sentinel node #2 has 1/1 positive lymph nodes. This means a total of 2 out of 7 lymph nodes are positive. Therefore, based on the AJCC staging system, the N stage is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma in one out of six lymph nodes in level I of the right axilla and in one out of one lymph node in level I of the right axilla. This results in a total of 2/7 positive lymph nodes (rounded to 2/6 or 1/3) which falls under N1 (metastasis in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes) stage. There is no extranodal extension of carcinoma. The number of positive lymph nodes in levels II and III is 0/9 and 0/2 respectively.
